did.abstract: Collection includes postcards, placards, booklets and other printed materials advertising and advocating for participation in Italy's war and savings bonds programs to finance war activities and pay off debts during World War I. Materials feature iconic and military graphic designs, governmental propaganda referencing victory, prosperity and Italian independence movements. Institutions represented include Credito Italiano and Banca Italiana di Sconto. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
